results.title: The Big combo
results.creator_credit: Allied Artists Pictures, Sidney Harmon and Joseph Lewis
results.brief_description: This is not just another gangster movie, but far more a private obsessional duel, a battle of wills between a smooth-tongued gangster and a fixated cop, which is resolved in terms of individual foibles and motivations. The film deals with a new brand of corporate business-minded gangster. The film’s two main characters (Leonard Diamond and Mr. Brown) run along parallel lines: both are haunted by chimeras of innocence, they are both aggressive in the pursuit of their differing ambitions. Stars Cornel Wilde, Richard Conte, Brian Donlevy, Jean Wallace.

results.title: The Big circus
results.creator_credit: Allied Artists Pictures, Irwin Allen and Joseph Newman
results.brief_description: Victor Mature plays circus owner, Hank Whirling, an autocratic boss whose business is under threat of closure from changes to the entertainment industry and a saboteur whose work threatens lives as well as business. After borrowing heavily to keep the circus afloat Whirling is burdened with the presence of bank officer Randy Sherman and publicist Helen Harrison. Moving with the times is not one of Whirling’s strong points and he takes exception to having a female press agent. In a bid to boost dwindling sales Whirling reluctantly agrees to allow Zack Colino, his top aerialist, to perform a media attention grabbing feat - crossing Niagara Falls on a tight rope. Humour, comedy and colour pervade the film that constitutes good-natured family fun, as well as consisting of some stunning stunts. Originally filmed in cinemascope, “The Big circus” features a star cast including Vincent Price, Peter Lorre and Red Buttons. This film was to be one of Mature’s last leading men roles. Producer Allen Irwin, also co-wrote the screenplay with some-time Hitchcock collaborator Charles Bennet.

results.title: The Big chill [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Michael Shamberg and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: The archetypal “Baby Boomers” movie of the 80’s which focuses on a group of college friends from the 60’s who have exchanged their radical ideals for Mercedes’ and “Yuppiedom”. In coming together at the funeral of one of their group, they strive to regain touch, not only with one another but with themselves. What follows is a weekend of drugs, sex, a re-examination of their anti-establishment days and a reconciliation of their past with their present. “In a cool world you need your friends to keep you warm.” This film will remain a nostalgic favourite. It features a great soundtrack and an early screen appearance by Kevin Costner as the corpse. Cast includes Tom Berenger, Glenn Close, Jeff Goldblum, William Hurt, Kevin Kline, Mary Kay Place, Meg Tilly and Jobeth Williams.

results.title: The Big cats: endangered predators
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles Sutton
results.brief_description: Members of the big cat family are shown in their natural environment. The commentary tells of the efforts being made to ensure the survival of the species.

results.title: The Big blue
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Patrice Ledoux and Luc Besson
results.brief_description: This is the poignant story of Jacques Mayol (Jean-Marc Barr), a free diving champion who must choose between his passion for the sea and his love of a New York businesswoman (Rosanna Arquette). His mettle as a human being is tested when he finds he must choose between two vastly different lifestyles. One with the passionate woman in one of the worlds largest cities and the other in a small village close to the sea which has always been his life. An extraordinarily beautiful film set against spectacular backdrops in Sicily, Paris, New York and the Greek Isles.

results.title: The Big backyard: the outback of South Australia
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions, Peter Dimond and Igor Auzins
results.brief_description: A young couple, on their honeymoon, travel in a four-wheel drive vehicle to the north and north-eastern areas of South Australia On their journey they see many points of interest including the opal mines of Coober Pedy, Lake Eyre, the Birdsville Track and Sturt’s Stony Desert and the varying barren landscapes of the outback of Australia. Cast: Christina Mackay and Bill Cain. Photographer: David Foreman.

results.title: The Bif if
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Vivienne King
results.brief_description: Looks at research being done on the drug Interferon. It is a substance that has been shown to have an effect on some viruses and tumors and scientists are hopeful that it will cure cancer and other life threatening diseases. A cheap synthetic version, if developed, would enable scientists to meet current world demand.

results.title: The Bicyclist
results.creator_credit: Kobenhavns Politi and Nordisk Film Junior
results.brief_description: A safety education film presented from the point of view of a red bicycle, owned first by a boy who obeyed the traffic rules and then by one who brought himself and the bicycle to a sad fate. The first boy is seen riding sensibly on the road and passing a police cycling test. The bicycle is then stolen by a lad whose reckless riding leads to a serious accident to himself and the bicycle falling into the river to rust. The film brings out a number of specific points about safe and dangerous cycling.

results.title: The Bicycle thieves = Ladri di biciclette
results.brief_description: An unemployed man is offered work as a bill-sticker provided he has his own bicycle. After retrieving his bicycle from the pawnbroker, it is stolen on the very first day of the job and he spends a day with his small son, desperately trying to find it. Hollywood offered to finance De Sica’s film, but he refused as he wanted to use non-actors in real settings. ‘The Bicycle thieves’ is an important film which explores the dignity of the ordinary person. It’s simplicity and underlying social criticism are part of its wide appeal.
